ygData.subject: Re: The great North
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes I see in your eyes you are sincere. Like me you seek the night your grace could easily lure anyone into a false sense of trust but somehow I know

"Yes I see in your eyes you are sincere. Like me you seek the night 
your grace could easily lure anyone into a false sense of trust but 
somehow I know otherwise. Who are these beings you speak of? are they 
robots like us? " Lunarpine follows his new aquaintance eager to 
learn all he can before deciding his final fate.
-- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Logo morph" <logomorph@h...> wrote:
> ::Shadow Wing::
> 
> 
> She looked at him.
> "Well Lunarpine, what do you feel like then?  What does your 
instincts tell 
> you to do?  When we get back to the ship, it may be that your 
talents will 
> be used for scouting, for fighting, for anything?  I don't know.  
I'm not 
> any kind of leader.  I hardly fit in myself.  But I try to do what 
I think 
> is right.  If you feel that this isn't right for you, then go and 
follow 
> your instincts.  But becareful.  There are those here that would 
use you for 
> scrap metal.  They will use what you have and then kill you when 
your 
> usefulness runs out.  I offer you a chance to make a difference and 
maybe 
> even a better chance of survival."
> She knelt down and stared into his wolf eyes.
> "Follow your instincts.  I followed mine and found some good 
friends. I hope 
> you choose the same path as I.  IF not,"  she sighed deeply, "I'd 
hate to 
> fight such a handsome bot as yourself."  She got up and started 
walking 
> through the forest.
> 
>
